titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. A. P. Quint, Indictment
CWG6372

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky --
against
A. P. Quint --

Bullitt Circuit Court, April Term A. D. 1865 The Grand Jurors of the County of Bullitt in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse A. P. Quint of the offense of Keeping a Tipling House -- Committed in manner and form as follows, towit, The said A P. Quint in the said County of Bullitt on the day of April A. D. 1865 knowingly and unlawfully did have and keep a tipling house wherein on divers and sundry days before and since as aforesaid he did sell and retail in small quantities less than one quart at a time and to be drank on the premises wine and brandy and whisky and other spirituous liquors and thus did keep said Tipling House contrary to the form of the statute in such cases, made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Dr. George F. Collins
James Allcorn
Joseph Sanders
Wm. Thos. Fox
Charles Hough
Moses Black

A Cop attest
C. R. Samuels Clk
